title: Mushroom & Pea Risotto
description: Creamy Italian-style risotto made with arborio rice, sautéed mushrooms, and sweet peas finished with Parmesan and a squeeze of lemon. Slow-stirred cooking builds a silky texture and deep savory flavor from white wine and mushroom stock.

ingredients.notes: cleaned and sliced about 5 mm thick
thawed to room temp or briefly rinsed under warm water
e.g., pinot grigio or sauvignon blanc
finely grated, plus extra for serving
adjust to taste and based on stock saltiness

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: bring vegetable stock to a gentle simmer in a saucepan and keep hot; clean and slice mushrooms, thaw peas, finely dice onion, and mince garlic.

In a large heavy-bottomed sauté pan or shallow pot, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and 20 g butter over medium-high heat. Add sliced mushrooms in a single layer and cook without stirring for 3 minutes to brown, then stir and cook until golden and any released liquid evaporates.
Season mushrooms lightly with a pinch of salt, transfer them to a plate and set aside.
Reduce heat to medium, add remaining tablespoon olive oil to the pan and add the diced onion. Sauté until translucent and soft, stirring frequently.
Add minced garlic to the onion and cook until fragrant (about 30 seconds) then add arborio rice and stir to coat grains in fat, toasting for 1 to 2 minutes until edges look translucent.
Pour in the white wine and stir continuously until it has mostly evaporated and the rice has absorbed the liquid.

Begin adding hot vegetable stock one ladle (about 120 ml) at a time, stirring frequently. Allow the rice to absorb most of the liquid before adding the next ladle. Continue this process, keeping the stock at a simmer and stirring regularly to release starches.

When the rice is tender but still has a slight bite (al dente) and the risotto is creamy — after most stock is incorporated but while still slightly saucy — stir in the cooked mushrooms and thawed peas and heat through for a couple of minutes.

Remove the pan from heat, stir in remaining butter and grated Parmesan until glossy and well combined. Add lemon juice, lemon zest if using, and adjust seasoning with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Let the risotto rest for 1 minute to set, then serve immediately garnished with chopped parsley and extra Parmesan if desired.
